anns.prefix: However, a comprehensive database of

anns.prefix: In this study, we compiled a
anns.postfix: gene database (RGDB) by scanning the four available databases: CARD, MIBiG, NCBIAMR, and UniProt.

anns.prefix: Every
anns.postfix: gene in the database was annotated with resistance mechanisms and possibly involved chemical compounds, using manual annotation and transformation from the resource databases.

anns.prefix: The RGDB was applied to analyze
anns.postfix: genes in 7432 BGCs in 1390 genomes from a marine microbiome project.

anns.prefix: Our calculation showed that the RGDB successfully identified

anns.prefix: Structural Annotation of Selected
anns.postfix: Genes of Terpenoid BGCs Terpenoids, as one of the most diverse and widely distributed natural products, have been a hot research topic in microbial natural products.

anns.prefix: Here, the RGDB-based method was applied to the MarRef-BGCs to identify those terpenoid BGCs containing
anns.postfix: genes.

anns.prefix: Specifically, we randomly selected one of four types of
anns.postfix: genes: product inactivation, target alteration, target protection, or target replacement.

anns.prefix: Due to their widespread presence in microbial BGCs and the absence of corresponding specific compounds, efflux pump
anns.postfix: genes have yet to be studied, and further research is needed.

anns.prefix: The structures of the
anns.postfix: genes in the RGDB were generated by alphafold [61] and obtained through an access link provided by Uniprot.

anns.prefix: Conclusions This study presented a comprehensive
anns.postfix: gene database (RGDB) by collecting data from four major databases: CARD, MIBIG, NCBIAMR, and UniProt.

anns.prefix: The database was designed for the analysis of the
anns.postfix: genes in BGCs in target-driven genome mining.

anns.prefix: Both possible
anns.postfix: mechanisms and compounds involved in the bioactivities of the resistance gene in the database were annotated.

anns.prefix: Scripts were provided for scanning the database to identify
anns.postfix: genes in query BGCS and the relevant compounds involving the resistance mechanisms.

anns.prefix: We applied RGDB-based annotation to analyze
anns.postfix: genes in 7432 BGCs in 1390 genomes in the MarRef database and found 7079 resistance genes in 3878 BGCs, of which, 59% are efflux pumps.

anns.prefix: Excluding these pumps, 3% of these
anns.postfix: carrier BGCs were found to have more than one type of resistance gene and mechanism.

anns.prefix: Excluding these pumps, 3% of these
anns.postfix: -gene carrier BGCs were found to have more than one type of resistance gene and mechanism.

anns.prefix: Notably, most of the
anns.postfix: genes in the database were prepared using terrestrial microorganisms.

anns.prefix: However, it could still identify
anns.postfix: gene candidates for more than half of all the marine microbial BGCs studied.

anns.prefix: All five types of
anns.postfix: mechanisms were found in marine microorganisms, and the associated compound of the resistance genes provides the starting point for inferring the possible products of BGCs.

anns.prefix: We also note that nearly half of the tested marine BGCs have no
anns.postfix: genes identified by the current RGDB.

anns.prefix: This suggests that unique
anns.postfix: mechanisms may exist in these marine microorganism BGCs that need to be discovered in future studies using new resources.

anns.prefix: The
anns.postfix: genes in the database are those that already exist.

anns.prefix: Regarding the fact that organisms follow the environment to evolve new
anns.postfix: genes, they may not be detected, but a preliminary judgment can be made based on the similarity of gene sequences.

anns.prefix: In the process of co-evolution of
anns.postfix: genes with the host, the original ones may be invalid, and the host will rapidly change its genome composition through mutation or recombination to ensure its adaptation to the current environment, so the resistance genes detected according to this database may not be the current effective resistance genes.

anns.prefix: Therefore, the database of
anns.postfix: genes should be able to keep up with the real-time research information and make timely supplemental adjustments to the annotation information to ensure the usability of the database annotation results.

anns.prefix: When we carry out the prediction of genome mining orientation, we can annotate the possible
anns.postfix: genes in BGC, but whether we can give full play to the role of orientation may not be realized only by the database; only the target-related resistance mechanism can predict the target and biological activity of the product.
